virtual-scroll-horizontal.desc: Make virtual list work in horizontal mode

virtual-scroll-slice-size.desc: Minimum number of items to render in the virtual list

virtual-scroll-slice-ratio-before.desc: Ratio of number of items in visible zone to render before it

virtual-scroll-slice-ratio-after.desc: Ratio of number of items in visible zone to render after it

virtual-scroll-item-size.desc: Default size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of an item; This value is used for rendering the initial list; Try to use a value close to the minimum size of an item

virtual-scroll-sticky-size-start.desc: Size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of the sticky part (if using one) at the start of the list; A correct value will improve scroll precision

virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end.desc: Size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of the sticky part (if using one) at the end of the list; A correct value will improve scroll precision

table-colspan.desc: The number of columns in the table (you need this if you use table-layout: fixed)

virtual-scroll.desc: Emitted when the virtual scroll occurs

details.desc: Object of properties on the new scroll position

index.desc: Index of the list item that was scrolled into view (0 based)

from.desc: The index of the first list item that is rendered (0 based)

to.desc: The index of the last list item that is rendered (0 based)

ref.desc: Vue reference to the QVirtualList which triggered the event

scrollTo.desc: Scroll the virtual scroll list to the item with the specified index (0 based)

index.desc: The index of the list item (0 based)

edge.desc: The edge to align to if the item is not visible already (by default it aligns to end if scrolling towards the end and to start otherwise); If the '-force' version is used then it always aligns

reset.desc: Resets the virtual scroll computations; Needed for custom edge-cases

refresh.desc: Refreshes the virtual scroll list; Use it after appending items

index.desc: The index of the list item to scroll to after refresh (0 based); If it's not specified the scroll position is not changed; Use a negative value to keep scroll position
